title: Farming Matters: Forcing Belgian Endive and Treviso Radicchio in The Upper Midwest with Peter Skold

tasks.task: Operate farming equipment for growing and harvesting chicories.
subtasks: Direct seed chicories in the field during mid-summer.
Weed and water chicories throughout the growing season.
Use an undercutter bar to lift and remove roots from the field.
Trim greens and retain the growing tip on chicory roots.
Store roots in a walk-in cooler at low temperatures and high humidity.

tasks.task: Force chicories indoors in a dark chamber.
subtasks: Transfer roots from the field to the forcing chamber.
Adjust water levels and monitor for light exposure during the forcing process.
Trim greens and separate roots after the forcing period.
Rinse and dry radicchio roots before packaging.

tasks.task: Market and distribute forced chicories to restaurants and other customers.
subtasks: Educate restaurant customers about the unique taste and benefits of forced radicchio and endive.
Adjust pricing and quantities based on market demand and agricultural supply.

tasks.task: Explore additional uses for spent chicory roots.
subtasks: Investigate feeding spent roots to livestock.
Research and test using roots for alternative products like coffee substitutes or brewing.
